title: Fix Baileys/Node.js ESM compatibility for WhatsApp plugin
notes:
## Error Message
```
SyntaxError: The requested module './newsletter.js' does not provide an export named 'makeNewsletterSocket'
```

## Context
- Baileys v7.0.0-rc.9 has ESM export issues when running under Node.js (tsx)
- Works fine under Bun due to more permissive module resolution
- WhatsApp plugin fails to load entirely with Node.js

## Why Node.js is Needed
- Bun's WebSocket implementation is incomplete
- Pairing codes don't work properly under Bun (codes generate but fail on phone)
- Some Baileys features rely on WebSocket events not implemented in Bun

## Current Workaround
- Running with Bun (pm2 start 'bun run packages/api/src/index.ts')
- Pairing code feature is broken
- QR code scanning still works

## Potential Fixes
1. **Downgrade Baileys** to stable v6.x (may lose features)
2. **Patch Baileys imports** to handle ESM correctly
3. **Use dynamic imports** with try/catch for newsletter module
4. **Wait for Baileys v7 stable** release with ESM fixes
5. **Contribute fix upstream** to Baileys repo

## Files Affected
- `packages/channel-whatsapp/package.json` - Baileys version
- Plugin loader fails at import time

## Test Command
```bash
# This fails with Node.js:
npx tsx packages/api/src/index.ts

# This works with Bun:
bun run packages/api/src/index.ts
```

title: Discord: Download media to local storage like WhatsApp (CDN URLs can expire)
description: Discord currently only stores attachment.url (CDN URL) without downloading locally. WhatsApp downloads to ./data/media/. This causes: 1) CDN URLs can expire 2) No local copy for processing 3) Inconsistent behavior. Fix: Download Discord attachments to local storage like WhatsApp does.

title: WhatsApp instances don't auto-reconnect after API restart
description:
## Problem
When the API restarts (e.g., pm2 restart), WhatsApp instances that were connected don't auto-reconnect on startup.

## Expected
Instances that were connected before restart should auto-reconnect automatically.

## Root Cause Analysis
- `reconnectWithPool()` queries for `isActive = true` instances
- But WhatsApp instances have `isActive = false` after restart
- The event listener in `event-listeners.ts` only sets `isActive = false` if reason includes 'logged out'
- Graceful shutdown uses reason 'User requested disconnect' which should NOT trigger the inactive flag
- Yet somehow `isActive` is getting set to `false`

## Possible Causes
1. Race condition: NATS closes ~4ms after disconnect events, listener may not process in time
2. Something else setting `isActive = false` synchronously during shutdown
3. The `isActive = true` from /connect route not being persisted correctly

## Files to Investigate
- `packages/api/src/plugins/event-listeners.ts:53-82` - disconnect event handler
- `packages/api/src/plugins/instance-monitor.ts:458-488` - reconnectWithPool
- `packages/api/src/index.ts:200-245` - shutdown handler
- `packages/api/src/routes/v2/instances.ts:404` - connect route sets isActive

## Suggested Fix
Consider adding a separate field like `shouldAutoConnect` that represents user intent, separate from runtime `isActive` state.
close_reason: Fixed: Removed line that marked instances inactive on startup reconnect failure. InstanceMonitor now retries with exponential backoff.

title: Investigate PIX native button support for WhatsApp
description:
## Goal
Investigate if we can support native WhatsApp PIX 'copia e cola' messages with the payment_info button.

## Background
- Native payment_info button requires WhatsApp Business account
- Regular accounts silently ignore the message (sends but doesn't render)
- Some Baileys forks (gifted-baileys, stvnnvs/baileys) claim to support this
- The baileys_helpers package adds additionalNodes support but still didn't work

## Research Needed
1. Confirm if payment_info truly requires business account
2. Check if any fork/patch enables this for regular accounts
3. Investigate if there's an alternative message format
4. Consider QR code image generation as fallback

## References
- https://baileys.giftedtech.co.ke/
- https://www.npmjs.com/package/baileys_helpers
- https://github.com/WhiskeySockets/Baileys

Handle WhatsApp Newsletter/Channel notifications
description: WhatsApp Channels (broadcast feature) send notifications that we currently log as 'Invalid mex newsletter notification'. These are recurring and should be properly handled - either processed/stored or explicitly ignored. The notifications contain: newsletter IDs, subscriber counts, channel names/descriptions, join events.
